intro: Ageratum matricarioides, commonly known as the Mexican blueweed, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and showy blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 15–30 centimeters and features narrow, gray-green leaves. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained soil. Ageratum matricarioides is often used in ornamental gardening for its vibrant flower color and ability to attract pollinators.
